isis.stitle: FRONT DRIVE AXLE WHEEL ENDS: ROCKWELL - GENERAL INFORMATION

svcproc.title: REPAIR OR REPLACE PARTS
svcproc.para: Replace worn or damaged parts of an axle assembly. The following are some examples to check.

step1.para: Replace any fastener if corners of the head are worn.
Replace gaskets, oil seals or grease seals at the time of axle or carrier repair.

Clean parts and apply new silicone gasket material where required when axle or carrier is assembled. Refer to CLEAN AND INSPECT, and GROUP 10 LUBRICATION AND SEALERS in CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for the proper silicone gasket material.
Remove rough edges from parts having machined or ground surfaces. Use a fine file, emery cloth or crocus cloth for this purpose.
Clean and repair threads of fasteners and holes. Use a die or tap of the correct size or a fine file for this purpose.

note.para: Threads must be clean and not damaged so that accurate torque values can be applied to fasteners.

step1.para: Tighten all fasteners to the correct torque values. Refer to TORQUE CHART.
Do not repair axle housings by bending or straightening.

caution.para: Repair of axle housings by bending or straightening can cause poor or unsafe operation of the axle and early failure.
